👉 Experience: 3-5 years👉 Qualification: Bachelor in computer science or equivalent. Masters would be preferred.Key Responsibilities:----------------------💡Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend solutions using C# and .NET.💡Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver high-quality software solutions.💡Implement and maintain microservices architecture for seamless system integration.💡Optimize application performance, ensuring robust and efficient backend processes.💡Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve issues in existing applications.💡Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.💡Participate in code reviews to uphold coding standards and best practices.💡Leverage AWS Workspace to ensure secure and efficient development and deployment processes.Requirements:-----------------💡Experience: 3-5 years in C# and .NET development.💡Proficiency in .NET, microservices, and AWS Workspace.💡React JS experience (preferred).💡Strong problem-solving and communication skills⌚️ Shift timings: 1pm-10pm📍 Job Type: Full timeInterested candidates can send their resumes To: careers@purelogics.net & cc': farah.farrukh@purelogics.net with the subject line " Senior .NET Engineer"Note: I'm not the hiring person. sharing job updates to help job seekers.Follow Akash Kandharkar for more job updates.hashtag#dotnet hashtag#reactjs hashtag#jobs

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? 6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

We question. 🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

𝐂𝐚𝐮𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐫𝐞𝐝-𝐡𝐚𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐝 — 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐰𝐚𝐥𝐤 𝐚𝐰𝐚𝐲 𝐥𝐢𝐤𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐡𝐚𝐩𝐩𝐞𝐧𝐞𝐝.We recently hired someone who seemed like a perfect fit — confident in interviews, solid experience on paper, and everything checked out… at first.Then came the background check:❌ Fake experience certificate❌ Lied about work durationWhen we confronted her (politely!), she first denied everything… and minutes later said, “I’m not comfortable working here.”Just like that — the excuses began.𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐰𝐡𝐞𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐨𝐩𝐥𝐞 𝐠𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐚𝐮𝐠𝐡𝐭, 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐲 𝐝𝐨𝐧’𝐭 𝐭𝐚𝐤𝐞 𝐚𝐜𝐜𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲 — 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐲 𝐣𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧?This isn’t just about documents — it’s about character.𝐀𝐬 𝐇𝐑, 𝐰𝐞’𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐝 𝐛𝐞𝐭𝐰𝐞𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬.We verify. We question. We find out.And yes, we always will.To the honest ones out there:✔️ Keep showing up with integrity — it will always set you apart.To the others:⚠️ The truth catches up, sooner or later.hashtag#HRDiaries hashtag#HiringLessons hashtag#WorkEthics hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#HRCommunity hashtag#ProfessionalIntegrity hashtag#StayAuthentic

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

.NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. .NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

.NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. 🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. .NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

.NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. 🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

.NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. .NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🔍 From .Net C# Interview QuestionsExplain Task.Factory in C#:Task.Factory: Part of the Task Parallel Library (TPL)Provides methods for creating  and starting Task instances.More configurable than basic Task constructors or Task.Run.🔑 Key Features of Task.Factory:Task Creation: Various methods for tailored task configurations.Custom Task Schedulers: Specify a TaskScheduler for bespoke scheduling.Task Creation Options: Supports diverse TaskCreationOptions for enhanced control.Continuation Tasks: Easy creation of tasks that start after another task completes.👨‍💻 Usage Examples:Opt for LongRunning tasks for dedicated threading.Define a custom TaskScheduler for precise execution control.Utilize continuation tasks for sequential task flows.hashtag#CSharp hashtag#DotNet hashtag#Task hashtag#TaskFactory hashtag#TPL hashtag#ParallelComputing hashtag#CodingInterviews

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. .NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. .NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. Just a chat.And to everyone who’s trusted me with their journey so far — thank you 🙏Please Like this post incase someone in your network needs to see this! 👍hashtag#CareerDevelopment hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Coaching hashtag#ThinkTalent hashtag#Hiring

.NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch. .NET Core TipStruggling with spam in your lead or contact forms, even with CAPTCHA in place? Here’s a quick tip to help reduce unwanted submissions effectively.Dealing with spam in your lead or contact forms can be incredibly frustrating. But don't worry, there's a solution!Using .NET Core 8.0 MVC, I'll show you how to effectively block spam submissions. The logic applies to any technology, so you can adapt it to your needs.Here's a typical contact/lead form:<form asp-action="contact" asp-controller="home" method="post"> <input class="form-control" type="text" maxlength="255" asp-for="FullName" placeholder="Your Name" required> <input class="form-control" type="email" maxlength="255" asp-for="Email" placeholder="Your Mail" required> <input class="form-control" type="text" pattern="^[0-9]*$" maxlength="15" asp-for="Phone" placeholder="Your Phone with country code"> <textarea class="form-control" asp-for="Message" cols="40" rows="5" maxlength="1000" placeholder="Your Message" required></textarea></form>Spammers use automated scripts to find and submit these forms, flooding your inbox with spam. To fight this, we will add a hidden input field to form:<input class="additional-note" type="text" style="display:none;">When the form is submitted, we check if this hidden field is empty. If it is, the submission is likely from a human. If not, it's probably spam.Here's the controller logic:[HttpPost("contact")][ValidateReCaptcha]public async Task<IActionResult> Contact(LeadModel model){ if (!ModelState.IsValid) return View(); try { bool result = await _contactService.SaveLead(model); TempData["success"] = result ? "We have received your request, we will get back to you shortly!" : "Sorry! We are not able to save your request."; return RedirectToAction("contact", "home"); } catch (Exception ex) { TempData["fail"] = "Sorry! Something went wrong to save your request."; _logger.LogError(ex, $"An error occurred to save lead - {Helper.Dump(model)}"); } return View();}And the business logic service:public async Task<bool> SaveLead(LeadModel? leadModel){ if (leadModel == null || !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(leadModel.RepeatLead)) return false; var lead = _mapper.Map<Lead?>(leadModel); return await _contactRepository.SaveLead(lead);}Implement this simple trick to keep your forms spam-free and ensure you only get genuine leads. 🚀💬 What do you think of this approach? Have you tried something similar? Share your thoughts in the comments below! And don't forget to share this post with your friends and colleagues who might find it useful. Let's help each other keep our forms spam-free! 💪hashtag#spamprevention hashtag#dotetcore hashtag#leadform hashtag#webdevelopment hashtag#leadgeneration hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp

🌟 BBA vs B.Com: Which One is Right for Your Career? 🤔Choosing the right undergraduate course is one of the first major career decisions — and BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) and B.Com (Bachelor of Commerce) often top the list.Here’s a quick breakdown to help you or your child make an informed choice:🔹 BBA – For Future Managers & Entrepreneurs ✅ Practical, industry-oriented approach ✅ Ideal for careers in marketing, HR, operations, or MBA prep ✅ Great for those who love leadership, presentations & projects🔹 B.Com – For Finance, Accounts & Core Commerce Roles ✅ Strong foundation in accounting, taxation, economics ✅ Ideal for careers in CA, CS, CFA, banking & analytics ✅ Great for those who love numbers, analysis & policy💡 Ask yourself: – Are you inclined toward leadership and management early on? → BBA – Do you want strong financial and accounting knowledge with career flexibility? → B.Com🎯 Pro tip: No course is "better" — it depends on your goals, learning style, and long-term vision.💬 What did you choose — or what would you recommend to today’s students? Share your thoughts in the comments 👇 hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#BBAvsBCom hashtag#StudentGuidance hashtag#HigherEducation hashtag#CareerChoices hashtag#LinkedInLearning hashtag#CollegeDecision hashtag#CommerceStudents

6 months in — a quick look at what’s happened… and just WOW.Over the past 6 months, I’ve worked closely with 54 professionals.Here’s what’s happened so far:✅ 46.3% have already received job offers✅ 38.89% of those have signed (some are still in negotiations)Each person came in with a different story — some actively job hunting, others simply exploring or feeling stuck.But one consistent theme across nearly every profile?Minimal responses. Limited visible opportunities.Considering a lot of these candidates are passive, and including quiet periods like December and Ramadan, the results feel even more special.So, what’s made most difference? To name a few key areas:- Being honest about where people are and what’s possible- Showing that there are opportunities — for everyone- Helping candidates position themselves clearly and effectively- Focusing on the shifts that actually make a differenceThis isn’t about quick wins. It’s about building confidence, clarity, and momentum — with a real, tailored approach and get the right opportunity.If you’re in a transition phase or just not sure what’s next, feel free to drop me a message.No pressure. No hard pitch.
